title: Spotting growth
intro: Successfully re-designed this company, where you can order your personalised portraits.
description:
Spotting growth is a marketing guru's personal website. I got hired to redesign the website and give the brand a fresh and creative look. My client already had a website that she was not happy with and wanted to bring me on board to help with the redesign. 

Some of the client's requirements included: 
- She wanted to incorporate 3D visuals and icons into her website 
- She wanted the website to be an even balance between corporate and fun 
- She wanted better styling of specific cards on the website, like the services card 

Keeping all requirements in mind I sucessfully designed a website my client was happy with and launched the redesigned website for her 1 year anniversary

title: Tourism website template
intro: Successfully re-designed this company, where you can order your personalised portraits.
description:
For this project, I got hired to design a tourism website template for Divi, which is a WordPress plugin. My client gave me creative freedom with some limitations I had to consider. 

My client requested website designs that are unique but simple enough to transfer to Divi. They also asked for a simple calendar layout that will immediately inform users of the date, time, event, and location. 

As a designer, it is essential to know how to work around limitations like steering clear of section layouts that are hard to translate into page builders. I designed each section carefully, making it creative and stylish while keeping it simple enough to transfer to Divi.

title: Chow
intro: An intuitive app to pick a random eatery or discover new places and try something different every time.
description:
Chow app is a personal project that is still in development. The idea was simple, build something that would help people decide on what to eat. Chow chooses a random eatery nearby the user's current location. 

We aimed to make the app fun, fresh and simple to use. Users can operate the app, both with and without signing up with us, making it accessible to everyone. Initially, we only wanted to add restaurants in the search results but, we decided to expand the search across more categories like cafes, bakeries, bars, etc. Why? We thought, if we were to use an app like Chow, we'd want to be able to search more than just restaurants. 

Chow is an app that enables users to explore restaurants they wouldn't usually try, which could help generate traffic to more obscure local restaurants, which, I hope, can help to enrich local communities.

title: Noble portraits
intro: Successfully re-designed this company, where you can order your personalised portraits.
description:
Noble portraits is a company that does commission portraits and sells prints. The works of art are by several artists from all over the world. 

I re-designed and re-branded their website by giving it a modern, elegant, and minimalist look. The user experience was drastically simplified to make it more accessible to people of all ages and to make sure that the purpose of the website is not lost, which would be to order a portrait or buy a print. Google's material design was used for all the components of this website.

title: Medical App
intro: An app that simplifies life for people seeking medical related services
description:
I got hired to redesign this app and simplify the user experience. This app focuses on giving users of all ages accessibility to multiple medical-related tasks. 

Users can find specialists close to them. They can call, message, and book appointments through the app with their preferred medical practitioners.

title: Flux28
intro: A website designed to fit the creativity of a multidisciplinary studio, that caters other companies.
description:
FLUX28©️ Studio is a multidisciplinary company with a team of filmmakers and multimedia artists working together to create substantial images and voices for many known brands. They thrive on honouring creative pursuits and design aesthetics to fit client’s goals of having high-quality production. 

The aim was to improve the overall layout of the website. I made use of different design elements to give the website a unique look. I suggested adding some micro-interaction which ultimately enriches the user experience.

title: Backyard paws
intro: A creative website designed for this unique company that provides pet grooming services.
description:
Backyard paws is a unique company that provides pet grooming services. They hired me to design an interactive website while using their style guide. 

I made a creative flow for the website using additional elements, like dotted lines and paw marks, to draw the eye from one section to the other.

title: AdEasy
intro: E-commerce company with new and improved ways to advertise through an online platform.
description:
AdEasy is a marketplace for online and offline advertising. Through this platform, advertisers can easily book ad space ranging in different media like billboards, newspapers, radio, websites, and much more. 

I worked with AdEasy as an in-house UI UX designer. Some of the projects that I was responsible for include: re-vamping the website, create a new design system to be used for consistent design and development on the website and dashboard and help improve the overall user experience of their dashboard.

title: ZB
intro: Successfully re-branded this agency that focuses on marketing and building brand identities.
description:
ZB is an agency that operates on a project basis. For each project, several freelancers get hired. The company mainly focuses on helping other businesses market themselves better and provides some design services like graphic, web, and app design. 

I worked with them on their company rebranding, which included a rework of their internal brand book and redesigning their website using the new brand guidelines. 

After successfully launching the new and improved brand, I continued to work with them as an outsourced designer for a handful of their client projects like Vyoo, Makeen, Sotere Medical Solutions, USA Fibroid Centers, and USA Vascular Centers.
